The best way to individually combat this is cite your sources and call into question other sources that appear to be untrustworthy. Some sources you won't need to state as untrustworthy or not such as a CDC (center for disease control) article on the flu as they have a reputation to uphold, direct accountability, and low to non-existent motive to mislead.
Others such as a CNN report on republicans or a Fox report on democrats will need to be independently researched, before sharing or accepting as truth.
Edit: minor grammar: democratic changed to democrats; non-motive changed to non-existent motive

Hey it works on both sides of an election some that appear blatant lies to me are accepted as canon to others. One particular one I heard was "Hillary absolutely enjoyed ordering killings and that she had the most evil smirk" and that was said to me by my father, he believes it.

And my point is it shouldn't come as a surprise that a man running for office be covered in controversy, a spotless man would cause me to worry more. (Just rereading some of the past elections and why do people want tabloid magazines when such things were printed in national newspapers in the past. They could just read a history book on the past elections)

That these articles that wrote ill of Trump, only surfaced during the election, my response is once someone runs for office a lot more people have a lot more incentive to find and Air the dirty laundry of the person running, look on Hillary and emails, Libya; this is not just today's Trump and Hillary. Obama and birth certificates and speculation and him being Muslim. JFK and being catholic. (Really the earlier you go the more outrageous the claims are, Jackson the 'bride stealer' comes to mind) Anyone running for office, especially running for a high office like POTUS, will have a dreadful amount of scrutiny on them.

I couldn't do avoidance once and now I'm dealing with the aftermath of a 10 car accident. (Some guy 4-6 cars behind me started the dominos of cars)

It's not like the car behind you is going to bail you at freeway speeds, he will move you but perhaps not much more than 6 ft? (This is under the assumption that he hits you while he is going 35 and he is not driving a substantially bigger car, I.e. Smart car hit by hummer)

II they killed the emperor of the largest empire that if let be would have developed the world at a faster pace.
X resolved the problem of a huge ball of destruction so capital could be centralized easier, and not randomly destroyed, I think that is a bigger plus than the murderof a few prominent figures (sucide in the case of Mika) and downfall of the most influential organization known as yevon.
XII prevents a total war so I think they did well in preventing a whole lot of loss, and cleared a few hunts.
Tactics (WotL) other then preventing luvici, they indirectly enabled a machiavellian-like man become king (perhaps good for the economy?) but on the other hand they did increase the length of a major war by flooding a battlefield. And destroyed a revolution that would have redistribute wealth to reduce inequality thus bettering the economy (caused the leader to become a demon later on). And caused chaos by killing quite a few influential figures, but that I think was for the better.
Hard to choose
It immersed you from the get-go
It did its function as an exposition so well, it covered the world and made it much more immersive. (And the battles between airships? That was pretty amazing)
I have it on IOS (WotL)
The main boss (not the super boss) isn't exactly evil, though at first you will be inclined to think so, and at the end you agree with him somewhat and feel bad for fighting him.
The world was fleshed out and really immersive

FF tactics war of the lions will keep you entertained for months. It's story is sweet, and it's quite customizable giving it high replay value. Only thing you might not like is it's tactics, much more emphasis on strategy rather than mashing attack. (Though if you go nuts and grind like I do and have triple the level than your opponent...)

Man and I just beat the game. It's has great dialogue, great music, and in my opinion great gameplay (though I wish the bosses were higher level, my lv 70 characters just pubstomped the final 4 battles like nothing.
